title: Ticket #4778: Expose remote configuration subsystem in the python bindings
description:
Per request on the HTCondor list, it would be convenient to provide python bindings for condor_config_val for a remote daemon.

I think having a dictionary-like object that exposes the remote daemon's config (analogous to the existing param object) is what we need here.
remarks:
2014-Dec-19 07:47:27 by bbockelm:
Merged to master; added version history, but could use some help with the other documentation prior to release.

2015-Jan-27 15:15:13 by smoler:
Some of the documentation has been attempted. I need a detailed eye to look over and provide corrections, as well as fill in the still missing details.

Issues:

  • there are 2 new classes, yes? Not 1? Param and RemoteParam
  • Since this is a dictionary-like class, should we or should we not be providing definitions of the functions:
    • __getitem__
    • __setitem__
    • __contains__
    • __iter__
    • __len__
  • Prose (function definition) needed for
    • Param:__iter__
    • RemoteParam:__iter__
    • Param:get
    • RemoteParam:get
